Dear Mr. McCree:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was harmed by staff while they were attempting to
prevent his self harm, as well as multiple occasions prior.
Investigation The Complainant was contacted on 10/28/2024 and no additional
information was provided.
Youth A was interviewed on 10/21/2024 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. He stated the incident started
when he and Youth B got into a fight while on the pod. Youth A
recalled that staff got involved right away and broke up the
fight. As that occurred, Youth A was restrained in order to get him
away from Youth B. Youth A could not recall who restrained
him. Youth A was then escorted to his room. Youth A recalled
Staff 1 being a part of his restraint. Youth A stated one of the
staff, possibly Staff 4, slammed his head against the wall of his
room multiple times. As this occurred Youth A stated he had
taken a head band and was trying to choke himself with it. Youth
A stated this occurred when he was standing up and the staff was
holding his hands behind him. Youth A believed this lasted for
about three seconds. Youth A offered that he was resisting the
restraint and fighting back against staff. Youth A stated the
restraint ended very quickly after that when he stopped fighting
back against staff. Youth A also commented that he did not think
Youth D and Youth E would have seen him get his head slammed
because he believed they had stepped out of the room. Youth A
could not be sure of this because he described his position within
his room as facing the inside for the entirety of the incident. Youth
A stated this has never happened before and he was not sure if
2

the allegations of past physical incidents were confusing him with
someone else.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
10/31/2024. Staff 1 recalled assisting with the effort to remove a
string of a head band from Youth A as Youth A was attempting to
self harm. Staff 1 recalled being with other staff in Youth A’s room
attempting to restrain him and take the head band away so he
would stop attempting to choke himself. Staff 1 described Youth A
as quickly escalated, fighting back and trying to grab items such
as walkie talkies from the staff’s person. Staff 1 believed there
were no other youth in the room at that time. Staff 1 recalled
Youth A’s attempts to fight back against the restraint and having
the item taken from him involving flailing his arms around as well
as hitting his head against the wall and his bed. Staff 1 denied
ever hitting Youth A’s head against anything. He recalled hearing
from nurses after the fact that Youth A was stating his head was
pushed against the wall and it hurt. Staff 1 stated the incident
ended quickly, within a minute or so, and Youth A was laying on
his back on the floor when he was released. Staff 1 re-iterated the
restraint was brief and staff were able to get the head band away
from Youth A, and that he did not see any staff hit Youth A’s head
against the wall.
Staff 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
10/31/2024. She stated she entered the pod and immediately saw
Youth A assaulting staff. Staff 2 assisted with a two person escort
of Youth A to his room. She recalled Youth A began to resist and
fight back as they got to his room. Staff 2 saw Youth A take a
head band and wrap it around his own neck, and she immediately
tried to assist in getting this out of his hands to prevent self
harm. As this was occurring Staff 2 recalled Youth A vomiting on
his floor and then sitting on the ground next to it. She stated this
was the end of the restraint and staff had their hands off of him at
this point. Staff 2 denied ever pushing Youth A’s head into the
wall, and she stated staff never took him to the ground. Staff 2
believed Youth A was on the ground under his own power at that
point in the incident. Staff 2 confirmed Staff 1 and Staff 4 were
assisting her for the entirety of the incident.
Youth B was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
10/31/2024. He recalled being in the pod with Youth A when the
incident occurred. Youth B remembered staff members trying to
restrain Youth A and take him to his room. Youth B recalled
seeing Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 4 having their hands on Youth A
from outside of his bedroom to going inside. Youth B stated he
3

could see inside the room only a little bit, but he did not see any
hitting or pushing of Youth A by staff.
Youth C was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
10/31/2024. Youth C stated that he could see in the room when
Youth A was being restrained and he did not see any staff hitting
or pushing Youth A.
Youth D was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
10/31/2024. Youth D recalled Youth A escalating and getting
upset at a staff member, commenting “I’m gonna get him thrown
off this pod.” He then remembered seeing Youth A attempting to
assault staff as they entered Youth A’s bedroom. Youth D stated
he could see in the bedroom somewhat, and denied seeing any
staff hit or push Youth A.
Youth E was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
10/31/2024. Youth E recalled seeing Youth A get restrained from
a close distance. Youth E did not believe that any staff pushed
Youth A up against the wall of his room or hit or push him in any
way.
Youth F was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
10/31/2024. Youth F recalled being in the pod and seeing Youth
A have to be escorted to his bedroom by staff. Youth A then
attempted to choke himself with something and caused himself to
throw up on the floor. Youth F believed that staff were able to get
the item away from Youth A, and in doing so Youth F never saw
anyone push Youth A’s head against the wall or hit or push him in
any way.
Staff 3 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
10/31/2024. Staff 3 stated he did not remember much about the
incident itself, recalling that other staff had to escort Youth A to his
bedroom. Staff 3 did see any staff push or hit Youth A during the
incident.
Staff 4 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
10/31/2024. Staff 4 recalled having to participate in an escort and
a restraint of Youth A. Youth A was resistant and escalated more
as they got into his room. After getting into his room, Youth A took
a piece of his clothing and attempted to choke himself with
it. Staff 4 recalled struggling with Youth A to try to get this item
out of his hands. In doing so, Staff 4 denied ever slamming Youth
A into his bed or a wall. Staff 4 stated that no other staff hit or
4

pushed Youth A during the incident despite Youth A’s “thrashing”
behavior.
It was reported during a video conference with DHHS Worker 1
on 11/15/2024 that her investigation had not yet been completed
and no results could yet be shared.
Video Reviewed:
• Facility security camera footage for 10/14/2024 was
provided and reviewed. Beginning at 5:36 pm this footage
showed the escort and restraint of Youth A. At 5:38:50 pm
Youth A was taken inside of his bedroom. The footage was
not able to show a view inside of the bedroom, and it was
confirmed that there was no second camera angle inside of
the pod.
Documentation reviewed:
• Training documentation for Staff 4 was provided and
reviewed, and it was shown that he was up-to-date on the
facility’s behavior management system training.
• Incident report documentation dated 10/14/2024 was
provided and reviewed. The information contained in the
incident report was consistent with interviews provided.
• Facility policy titled “Verbal Intervention (Crisis Counseling)”
was provided and reviewed. This policy stated that staff
are to use physical interventions (restraints) only when a
youth is in the act of harming themselves, among other
reasons.
• Facility medical documentation dated 10/15/2024 was
provided and reviewed. In this documentation it was noted
that Youth A denied feeling any pain or concussive
symptoms despite reporting that he bumped his head on
the wall due to resisting a restraint. Youth A commented in
this documentation that Staff 1 and Staff 4 were too rough
with him as a result of having to be restrained while
wrapping a piece of clothing around his neck because he
was upset.
• Facility policy on youth discipline and behavior
management was provided and reviewed. This
documentation outlined prohibited conduct from staff to
youth, including any type of physical discipline.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, video footage and other documentation
5

reviewed. There was no evidence found to show that staff caused
Youth A’s head to hit a wall during the restraint incident.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Title prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (2) The following restraints are strictly prohibited:
Description (g) Peer-on-peer discipline or utilizing the assistance of
another youth to implement a restraint.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A was restrained by other youth while staff were restraining
and escorting him during the 10/14/2024 incident.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed on 10/21/2024 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. In describing the restraint incident,
Youth A recalled other youth coming into his room to attempt to
restrain Youth A, naming Youth D and Youth E. Youth A could not
recall if staff also involved told the other youth to stop assisting in
the restraint. Youth A believed the other youth that had their
hands on him let go once he was inside of his room.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
10/31/2024. Staff 1 stated that no other youth put their hands on
Youth A during the incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
10/31/2024. She could not recall if any of the other youth in the
pod had their hands on Youth A during the incident. Staff 2
recalled telling Staff 3 to make sure the other youth backed off as
Youth A escalated and had to be restrained.
Youth B was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
10/31/2024. He recalled being in the pod with Youth A when the
incident occurred. Youth B stated he assisted in restraining Youth
A to get him to his bedroom. He did so by grabbing Youth A’s
arms and walking with staff and Youth A to the bedroom. Youth B
recalled Youth A beginning to resist the restraint. Youth B
commented that he was able to see into the bedroom because he
had gotten so close to the doorway. He recalled Staff 4 and Staff
6

2 telling him to not assist in the restraint, but they did not attempt
to stop him or move him backwards either. Youth B commented
that youth are supposed to receive consequences for putting their
hands on another youth in that manner, but he never did.
Youth E was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
10/31/2024. He recalled helping escort Youth A to his room, and
specifically stated that he had his hands on the waist of Youth A
and helped move him with staff’s assistance. Youth E was never
told by staff that he needed to disengage from Youth A and
commented that one of the staff members thanked him
afterwards. Youth E could not recall who this staff was.
Staff 3 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
10/31/2024. He recalled being told by Staff 2 to keep other youth
away from Youth A during the incident but could recall if he was
successful in doing so.
Video footage reviewed:
• Facility security camera footage for 10/14/2024 was
provided and reviewed. Beginning at 5:36 pm this footage
showed the escort and restraint of Youth A. In the next two
minutes staff members restrained and escorted Youth
A. Two youth assisted in the restraint and escort of Youth
A along with the three staff that were already physically
engaged with him. Staff did not physically intervene with
these two youth that were physically engaged with Youth
A. The video footage does not have audio to show what
verbal directives came from staff.
Documentation reviewed:
• Incident report documentation dated 10/14/2024 was
provided and reviewed. The information contained in the
incident report did not state whether other youth physically
engaged with Youth A during the restraint and escort.
• Facility policy titled “Behavior Management System,
Behavioral Intervention Techniques” was provided and
reviewed. This policy stated that only staff who are trained
in the approved, safe, non-violent physical intervention
techniques shall use a physical intervention.
7

Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, video footage and other documentation
reviewed. There was evidence found that staff did not properly
intervene while other youth were physically engaged and
restraining Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
